description.plain:
Katheryn Elizabeth “Katy” Hudson (born October 25, 1984), known by her stage name Katy Perry, is an American singer, songwriter, businesswoman, philanthropist, and actress. She was born and raised in Santa Barbara, California. Having had very little exposure to mainstream pop music in her childhood, she pursued a career in gospel music as a teen and released her debut self-titled studio album in 2001. She also recorded a second solo album in 2005, (A) Katy Perry, which was scrapped.

Afterwards, Perry (her mother’s maiden name, taken to avert confusion with Kate Hudson) reinvented herself  as a party girl pop star,  breaking out with 2008’s One of the Boys and the #1 hits “I Kissed a Girl” and “Hot n Cold”.

Follow-up Teenage Dream (2010) equalled Michael Jackson’s record of five chart-toppers on the same album, and made Perry even more ubiquotous in the pop landscape. Following her marriage and eventual divorce from British comedian Russell Brand, she released an updated version, Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection and concert film Katy Perry: Part of Me in 2012. She released her fourth album, Prism, in 2013, along with some standalone singles, such as “Rise”.

In 2017 Katy began promoting her fourth album by releasing the Skip Marley collaboration “Chained to the Rythm” on February 10 and performing it live at the 2017 Brit Awards 12 days later. Two singles “Bon Appétit” featuring Migos and “Swish Swish” featuring Nicki Minaj followed before the release of the album. Titled Witness, Katy’s fifth LP (fourth under her current name) debuted at #1 on the Billboard #200, marking her third #1 in the U.S.

songs.full_title: Swish Swish by Katy Perry (Ft. Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Swish Swish

description.plain:
“Swish Swish” is the third single from Katy Perry’s fifth studio album, Witness and marks the first song featuring vocals from both Katy Perry and Nicki Minaj. It is a self-empowerment anthem that calls out haters. Katy has mentioned that her album is about a “360° liberation” and this song is about escaping pointless negativity. The central hook uses the image of a basketball player consistently scoring points, imitating the ‘swish’ sound of the hoop’s net.

Fans speculated the song to be a response to Taylor Swift’s 2014 hit “Bad Blood,” citing many lyrical references.

This was later confirmed when she starred in James Corden’s Carpool Karaoke interview. Katy explained:

She started it and it’s time for her to finish it. Now, there is the law of cause and effect. You do something, there’s going to be a reaction, and trust me, daddy, there’s going to be a reaction.

The song was indirectly confirmed days prior by EDM artist and ex-Taylor flame Calvin Harris, who said he “wasn’t involved” in a now-deleted tweet.

songs.full_title: Chained to the Rhythm by Katy Perry (Ft. Skip Marley)
songs.title: Chained to the Rhythm
songs.title_with_featured: Chained to the Rhythm (Ft. Skip Marley)

description.plain:
“Chained To The Rhythm” continues Katy’s trend of releasing catchy lead singles, but also features more politically charged lyrics than her prior projects. Perry described the song itself as “purposeful pop” on her Twitter. The song features Skip Marley, the grandson of Bob Marley.

The release culminates a guerrilla marketing effort in which disco balls with headphone jacks were strategically placed in cities around the world. Fans who hunted them down got to listen to “Chained to the Rhythm” before its official debut, including us.

https://twitter.com/Genius/status/829366314309390336?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

The song was performed live for the first time at the 2017 Grammy Awards.

The official music video was released on February 21st, 2017. The video is directed by Mathew Cullen and shows Katy visiting a futuristic theme park called ‘Oblivia’.

songs.title: Dark Horse

description.plain:
“Dark Horse” is a song by American singer Katy Perry, released as the official third single from her studio album, PRISM. The song was originally released first on September 17, 2013, as a promotional single from the album.

Commercially, the song became Perry’s overall ninth number one single on the Billboard Hot 100, and her second from PRISM, as “Roar” reached the top spot months prior.

songs.full_title: Bon Appétit by Katy Perry (Ft. Migos)
songs.title: Bon Appétit

description.plain:
“Bon Appétit” is the second single off of Katy Perry’s fifth studio album, Witness. The song features the hip-hop group Migos. Perry teased the track in a pre-Grammy Interview with radio host Ryan Seacrest, stating that it’s “pretty sexual.”

On the summery dance-pop track, Perry boasts about her efforts to fulfill a lover’s sexual appetites. The track contains many food-related sexual innuendos. During her appearance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Perry said the song represented “sexual liberation”.

Perry hinted the release of the song by emailing fans a recipe for the “World’s Best Cherry Pie”.



The song marks the first collaboration between Perry and the Atlanta trio.

annotatable.title: Bon Appétit

body.plain:
“Bon Appétit” is the second single off of Katy Perry’s fifth studio album, Witness. The song features the hip-hop group Migos. Perry teased the track in a pre-Grammy Interview with radio host Ryan Seacrest, stating that it’s “pretty sexual.”

On the summery dance-pop track, Perry boasts about her efforts to fulfill a lover’s sexual appetites. The track contains many food-related sexual innuendos. During her appearance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Perry said the song represented “sexual liberation”.

Perry hinted the release of the song by emailing fans a recipe for the “World’s Best Cherry Pie”.



The song marks the first collaboration between Perry and the Atlanta trio.

songs.full_title: Roar by Katy Perry
songs.title: Roar

description.plain:
“Roar” is the lead single off Katy Perry’s fourth studio album Prism. The song deviates from the electro-pop sound on Teenage Dream in exchange for a mid-tempo pop-rock anthem similar to Sara Bareilles‘ “Brave.”

The song is a self-empowerment anthem that one critic described as a “stylistic return to the arena-sized singer-songwriter formula that made her debut One of the Boys so remarkable.”

The song was written by Dr. Luke and Perry’s longtime friend Bonnie McKee, both of whom co-wrote the singer’s other #1 hits “Teenage Dream,” “California Gurls,” and “Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.)”.

songs.full_title: Firework by Katy Perry
songs.title: Firework

description.plain:
“Firework” is a song by American singer Katy Perry from her third studio album, Teenage Dream. The song was released as the third single, following the success of singles “California Gurls” and “Teenage Dream”.

Lyrically, “Firework” is meant to be an inspiration for anyone who’s ever felt worthless or unloved. Its message that everyone is beautiful and capable of leaving the world in awe really resonates with artist Katy Perry.

In fact, she has said that “Firework” is her favorite of all the songs she’s ever written. In an interview at the Grammy’s, she said that she was inspired to write the song after reading a paragraph in Jack Kerouac’s novel On the Road.

songs.full_title: Never Really Over by Katy Perry
songs.title: Never Really Over

description.plain:
“Never Really Over” is Katy Perry’s first solo 2019 pop single and her first promotional single since her 2017 studio album, Witness. The song was announced via Perry’s social media on May 28, 2019, three days before its release. A day later, Perry also teased a visual for the song.

“Never Really Over” marks Perry’s second time working with Zedd, following their 2019 collaboration “365”, though Zedd is not credited as a primary artist on “Never Really Over.”

The song’s lyrics deal with the end of a relationship and the possibility of the couple getting back together to have it fall apart again.

This could be an ode to her on-again-off-again relationship with fiancé, Orlando Bloom; who after three years, proposed to Perry on Valentine’s Day of 2019.

She says the song is about how all of our relationships – from first love, through failed love, to great love – all become a part of you so that none are ever really over: “You lived your past, and whatever it was, you learn.”

songs.full_title: The One That Got Away by Katy Perry
songs.title: The One That Got Away

description.plain:
In The One That Got Away, Katy reminisces about a former lover. She promises him that if only things had worked out differently, they could have spent their lives together.

Years later, during her livestream for the release of her 2017 album Witness, Katy revealed the track is about Josh Groban during a game of “Spill Your Guts or Fill Your Guts” with James Corden.

songs.full_title: I Kissed a Girl by Katy Perry
songs.title: I Kissed a Girl

description.plain:
“I Kissed a Girl” is a song recorded by Katy Perry, released as the lead single from her studio album, One of the Boys. The song finds Perry detailing an intimate experience with another woman.

The song launched Perry’s career by becoming her first biggest worldwide hit. The song peaked at number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart for a total of seven consecutive weeks.

songs.full_title: Rise by Katy Perry
songs.title: Rise

description.plain:
“Rise” is about striving to overcome adversity. Katy Perry wrote the song after years of feeling “a need for our world to unite.”

Upon the release of the song, NBC immediately announced their choice to use it for their coverage of the 2016 Rio Olympics, with syncs planned across the network’s platforms. Perry applauded their decision, referencing the Olympic athletes' inspiring strength and perseverance. Many Olympians make appearances in the music video, including swimmer Michael Phelps, gymnast Simone Biles, swimmer Missy Franklin, and sprinter Usain Bolt.

Katy Perry released the official music video on August 4, 2016, just one day before the Rio Olympics opening ceremony:

songs.full_title: California Gurls by Katy Perry (Ft. Snoop Dogg)
songs.title: California Gurls

description.plain:
In 1965 The Beach Boys recorded the original “California Girls.” Their lyrics proclaimed that none of the other girls in the US could top California girls. In Perry’s number one hit “California Gurls” we hear how amazing West Coast girls are from one of them.

The song features Californian rapper and first time collaborator Snoop Dogg. He borrows a line directly from the Beach Boys when he says “I really wish you all could be California Girls.”

songs.full_title: Smile by Katy Perry
songs.title: Smile

description.plain:
In the upbeat summer anthem, “Smile,” American singer-songwriter Katy Perry talks about battling failures and rejection before being able to “crack that smile.” The song was initially speculated to be the lead single off her highly anticipated fifth studio album, her first major project since 2017’s Witness, but it was later confirmed that “Daisies” was the album’s first official single.

Back in late February 2020, rumours of Perry releasing two new songs were circulating around the internet. This was later then backed up by the fact that one of the reported songs with the initials “NWW” was released on March 5, 2020, as “Never Worn White.”

In early May 2020, the song’s original demo featuring American rapper Diddy leaked online. A few months later in July 2020, the song was registered under Perry’s name on both ASCAP and BMI as “Smile (I’m Grateful),” with both registrations including Diddy’s feature on the track.

During a Facebook Q&A session she held on April 12, 2020, Perry revealed that she had “multiple, big deliveries coming this summer” and also alluded to the song when she talked about hoping the COVID-19 pandemic will end “and [we can all] smile again soon.” Not long after her livestream ended, a snippet of the track started to circulate around the internet, starting a frenzy amongst fans on Twitter. Nearly a month later – on May 5, 2020 – the track leaked in full.

songs.embed_content: Read “Smile” by Katy Perry on Genius

annotatable.link_title: Smile by Katy Perry
annotatable.title: Smile

body.plain:
In the upbeat summer anthem, “Smile,” American singer-songwriter Katy Perry talks about battling failures and rejection before being able to “crack that smile.” The song was initially speculated to be the lead single off her highly anticipated fifth studio album, her first major project since 2017’s Witness, but it was later confirmed that “Daisies” was the album’s first official single.

Back in late February 2020, rumours of Perry releasing two new songs were circulating around the internet. This was later then backed up by the fact that one of the reported songs with the initials “NWW” was released on March 5, 2020, as “Never Worn White.”

In early May 2020, the song’s original demo featuring American rapper Diddy leaked online. A few months later in July 2020, the song was registered under Perry’s name on both ASCAP and BMI as “Smile (I’m Grateful),” with both registrations including Diddy’s feature on the track.

During a Facebook Q&A session she held on April 12, 2020, Perry revealed that she had “multiple, big deliveries coming this summer” and also alluded to the song when she talked about hoping the COVID-19 pandemic will end “and [we can all] smile again soon.” Not long after her livestream ended, a snippet of the track started to circulate around the internet, starting a frenzy amongst fans on Twitter. Nearly a month later – on May 5, 2020 – the track leaked in full.

songs.full_title: Teenage Dream by Katy Perry
songs.title: Teenage Dream

description.plain:
“Teenage Dream” was released as the second single from Perry’s studio album of the same name. The song became Perry’s second number one Hot 100 single from the album, following the number one peak of the previous single, “California Girls”.

While discussing “Teenage Dream,” Katy said that the song is about recapturing the dizzying, thrilling feeling of first love.

When you’re growing up and you’re falling in love for the first time, it’s such an amazing feeling that sometimes you can’t recycle again later on in your life. For me, being in love again now, it’s kind of the same feeling.

songs.full_title: Hot N Cold by Katy Perry
songs.title: Hot N Cold

description.plain:
Coming in ‘hot’ as her second single from One of the Boys “Hot N Cold” is a song about a boy who is constantly changing his mind and going through mood swings – and how all of this annoys Perry and affects her relationship with him. In the years since its release, “Hot n Cold” has become a Perry standard, and is one of her more recognizable songs to date.

Unlike the guy in the song, the song’s reception was anything but cold; it was the second-most successful single off of One of the Boys, peaked at #3 on the Billboard Hot 100, and won Perry a Grammy nomination for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance.

Since its release, the song has been featured in a commercial, film, and even video game.

songs.full_title: Daisies by Katy Perry
songs.title: Daisies

description.plain:
Marking the start of a new era, “Daisies” is a self-empowerment anthem by American singer-songwriter Katy Perry. Shortly after the track’s release, Katy took to her social media platforms to share the inspiration behind the song:

I wrote this song a couple [of] months ago as a call to remain true to the course you’ve set for yourself, regardless of what others may think.

She then elaborated on how the song has “taken a new meaning [for her]” after parts of the world went into a lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Unlike her past lead singles which tend to be more upbeat and bubbly, “Daisies” features a mid-tempo production in its verses and a guitar in its chorus. This is also Katy’s first time working with The Monsters & Strangerz — an American production and songwriting team who has previously worked on hits like January 2018’s “The Middle.”

songs.full_title: Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.) by Katy Perry
songs.title: Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.)

description.plain:
“Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.)” is an ode to partying heavily. In the music video, Perry (portraying her alter ego, Kathy Beth Terry) celebrates a party at her house on a Friday night. As much as Kathy regrets everything that she did on that Friday night, she wants nothing more than to do it all again next week. The acronym “T.G.I.F” stands for “Thank Goodness It’s Friday,” hence the second part of the title.

The song became Katy Perry’s fifth consecutive number-one Hot 100 single from the album. With “Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.),” Perry broke a record becoming the first woman in the 53-year history of Billboard to have five of her singles from the same album reach number one on the Billboard Hot 100.

songs.full_title: Witness by Katy Perry
songs.title: Witness

description.plain:
“Witness” is the opening track from the album by the same name. The song is about looking for a lover/partner that has witnessed her popstar life and can commit to her. The song was leaked on Soundcloud after her Twitter account was hacked on May 30, 2016..

Later in 2017, Perry teased the song in an announcement (later confirmed to be about The Witness World Tour) slated for May 15, 2017.

songs.full_title: Never Worn White by Katy Perry
songs.title: Never Worn White

description.plain:
Katy Perry’s first release of 2020, “Never Worn White,” is a wedding-themed ballad where she croons about wanting to have a long-lasting relationship with a lover. The track’s music video made global headlines for revealing her visible baby bump.

Insight about the song first leaked in late February 2020, referred to as “NWW.” Lyrics to the song and its release date were then disclosed by a ‘music insider’ on March 3rd, 2020.

On March 2nd, 2020, Perry legitimized the leak when she tweeted: “wait, see you Wednesday night I mean 🤤,” alluding to the song’s release date—Wednesday March 4th at 9:00 PM PDT. The song was later unveiled by Katy via social media a day before its release.

The track marks American singer-songwriter Katy Perry’s fourth droplet single after the release of her fourth studio album, Witness. It was preceded by the summery anthem “Harleys In Hawaii.”

description.plain:
“E.T.” was released as the fourth single from  Perry’s album Teenage Dream. The remixed single version of the song features rap verses from rapper Kanye West.

The song finds Katy comparing her lover to an extra-terrestrial – mysterious, mystifying and unique.

songs.full_title: Harleys In Hawaii by Katy Perry
songs.title: Harleys In Hawaii

description.plain:
“Harleys In Hawaii” is the third single off Katy’s fifth studio album. It was preceded by “Small Talk” and “Never Really Over”, released earlier in the year. The release marks the second time Katy has worked with chart-topping singer/songwriter/producer Charlie Puth; their first collaboration being on her previous single, “Small Talk.”

This summery anthem was first announced in an interview with The Zach Sang Show in July 2019. Katy later revealed the song’s release date in a tweet on October 15, 2019, simultaneously unveiling the cover art.

The inspiration for “Harleys In Hawaii” came when Perry’s current fiancé, Orlando Bloom took the singer on a motorcycle ride in Hawaii, during the filming of American Idol. She said during an interview with the Zach Sang Show:

To be on the back of a motorcycle in Hawaii with the air blowing on your face is so beautiful. I was whispering to Orlando: ‘I’m going to write a song called “Harleys in Hawaii,”‘ and I did. It just dropped into my head.

“Birthday” is one long double entendre in which Katy compares birthdays to sex. It serves as the fourth single to Prism.

In the music video, Katy assumes five convincing personas and ruins other people’s parties, hidden-camera-style.

songs.full_title: Unconditionally by Katy Perry
songs.title: Unconditionally

description.plain:
“Unconditionally” is a soaring ballad about accepting one’s lover, both his virtues and flaws. The song was released as the second single of Prism, and Katy Perry’s favorite song on the album.

Katy Perry, in an interview with KIIS FM, explained the songs’s meaning:

Not only is it about those different varieties of loves, it’s about when you are in love with someone and there’s full acceptance. The highs and the lows. All the flaws. The zits. The smells. The whole gamet, you know? Sometimes I remember being scared to be accepted in relationships and I know that everybody else goes through that and, ‘Will they love my true self? Will they love all the things that I do when nobody’s looking?

Katy Perry was appointed UNICEF’s Goodwill Ambassador in 2013.  She had revealed that she was inspired to write this song as a result of a visit to Madagascar with UNICEF.

And so I went to the top of this mountain, I saw all these children, and the love that they had towards each other, they had no idea what Twitter or Facebook or any of that stuff was, they didn’t care about it.It was this unconditional love between all of them. It was that kind of pure love that’s unaffected by the trends of the world.

annotatable.link_title: Unconditionally by Katy Perry
annotatable.title: Unconditionally

body.plain:
“Unconditionally” is a soaring ballad about accepting one’s lover, both his virtues and flaws. The song was released as the second single of Prism, and Katy Perry’s favorite song on the album.

Katy Perry, in an interview with KIIS FM, explained the songs’s meaning:

Not only is it about those different varieties of loves, it’s about when you are in love with someone and there’s full acceptance. The highs and the lows. All the flaws. The zits. The smells. The whole gamet, you know? Sometimes I remember being scared to be accepted in relationships and I know that everybody else goes through that and, ‘Will they love my true self? Will they love all the things that I do when nobody’s looking?

Katy Perry was appointed UNICEF’s Goodwill Ambassador in 2013.  She had revealed that she was inspired to write this song as a result of a visit to Madagascar with UNICEF.

And so I went to the top of this mountain, I saw all these children, and the love that they had towards each other, they had no idea what Twitter or Facebook or any of that stuff was, they didn’t care about it.It was this unconditional love between all of them. It was that kind of pure love that’s unaffected by the trends of the world.

songs.full_title: Hey Hey Hey by Katy Perry
songs.title: Hey Hey Hey

description.plain:
“Hey Hey Hey” is a power anthem from Katy Perry’s fourth studio album, Witness. On “Hey Hey Hey”, Katy declares to the world that even though she is feminine and soft, she is definitely not weak or fragile, but rather strong and resilient. Norwegian singer-songwriter, Astrid S provides backing vocals on the track.

Perry described the song as very “descriptive” and “colorful” and teased it as a potential single.

The song is one of the two songs co-written by Australian singer, Sia. The other being the lead single, “Chained To The Rhythm”.

annotatable.link_title: They ask you how you are, and you just have to say you’re fine by Katy Perry
annotatable.title: They ask you how you are, and you just have to say you're fine

body.plain: Not a song but an amazing meme

songs.lyrics: "You know, sometimes you can be blinded by your extreme emotions. I definitely was looking for answers, during that time when I wrote that song, and yeah, I was depressed and sad, and there were thoughts, but there were never actions, thankfully. But I wanted to share that side of my story, because I know there are so many other people out there that have gone through things like that, and you always feel like you’re the only one going through that. You walk out the door, and you see someone you know, and they ask you how you are, and you just have to say you’re fine when you’re not really fine, but you just can’t get into it, because they would never understand. Well, then comes along a song that speaks to you, that makes you feel like ‘Gosh, I can get through this if she can get through this, I can get through this.'"

songs.full_title: Part of Me by Katy Perry
songs.title: Part of Me

description.plain:
“Part of Me” details a relationship in which a man holds Katy down. He took a lot of things away from her, but she tells him that there’s still a part of her left that he will never be able to take away- presumably her passion for music.

The song would later name a documentary\concert movie about Katy’s tour.

songs.full_title: Small Talk by Katy Perry
songs.title: Small Talk

description.plain:
“Small Talk” is a single by Katy Perry which was co-written by singer-songwriter Charlie Puth.

Katy said in an Instagram livestream that the song is about a relationship that ended, but you still run into them occasionally. Instead of having an intimate conversation, it’s just an awkward conversation filled with small talk. She also said that “the song is not about a particular person.” Instead, inspiration is drawn from how conversations and relationships change in general, after a relationship ends.
Writing the song took two days.

Katy Perry on her Instagram livestream about working with Charlie Puth:

I loved working with Charlie. He actually beat-boxes over the beat. https://www.instagram.com/p/B09JGODn2B_/?igshid=ubiw4iu3zxkx

Puth showed disappointment after learning the track’s title was leaked in a recent Instagram live:

https://twitter.com/perrycrave/status/1156057948763770881?s=20

songs.full_title: Thinking of You by Katy Perry
songs.title: Thinking of You

description.plain:
“Thinking of You” is a song from Katy Perry’s One of the Boys, released as the third single from the album. The song became her first ballad to be released as a single.

The song finds Katy describing her past with a former lover, who she considered to have been her best relationship. Even though she’s with someone new, she isn’t as happy with her current boyfriend as she was with her ex.

songs.full_title: Power by Katy Perry
songs.title: Power

description.plain:
“Power” is an empowerment track about demonstrating your power and strength to a partner. Katy explained that this song was for the women out there trying to find their power.

The song was produced by Jack Garratt and was teased in her Instagram story. Prior to the official track list announcement the track was referred to as “Goddess”.

Katy further teased the track when she attended a Women’s March in Washington D.C. in January 2017, five months before the song’s release. She took to the streets while holding a sign with a lyric from the second verse.

songs.full_title: Cry About It Later by Katy Perry
songs.title: Cry About It Later

description.plain:
Cry About It Later is the 2nd track off of Katy Perry’s 5th studio album Smile. It is an upbeat song about fixing your broken heart by going to the club and finding someone new to help you forget your old love so you can Cry About It Later.

The song got a Video in the Smile Video Series on August 28th.

songs.full_title: Déjà Vu by Katy Perry
songs.title: Déjà Vu

description.plain:
“Déjà Vu” is a French expression used to describe  current event that has already happened in the past, or an event which has a strangely familiar feeling; one is seeing it all again.

“Déjà Vu” is an electro R&B tinged track. Katy first teased it on March 14, 2017 by releasing a vocals-only clip on her Instagram story. On the track, Katy describes a stagnant relationship where their arguments and issues are the same as they were in the past. When Katy sees their relationship, all she sees is the past repeating itself. She echoes this sentiment on track “Pendulum” later on in the album.

songs.full_title: Miss You More by Katy Perry
songs.title: Miss You More

description.plain:
On “Miss You More,” Perry talks about a past lover and how there are so many things that remind her of the time they spent together.

The track is speculated to be about Perry’s ex-lover, American singer John Mayer, whom she dated in 2012. The two broke up in 2015 but remained on good terms. John Mayer has been inspiration for Perry’s song Double Rainbow from her album, Prism.

Originally started for her previous album under the name “Bad Photographs,” the sentiment itself turned into this current version. In a livestream, Katy stated that when she was upset or crying, she would sometimes take photographs of herself, that she wanted to capture all feelings, not just the good times. If she felt like she was starting to regain feelings for her past love, they’d remind her to think “Oh, should I… is this a good idea again?”

songs.full_title: Save as Draft by Katy Perry
songs.title: Save as Draft

description.plain:
“Save As Draft” uses technological allusions such as Twitter to convey her struggles to say what she has on her mind to her lover, but ultimately does not. In doing so Perry also reflects on the sloppiness of the digital world we live in. The track opens with the sound of typing on a keyboard.

Perry had teased the track via Twitter in 2015.

songs.full_title: Not the End of the World by Katy Perry
songs.title: Not the End of the World
songs.title_with_featured: Not the End of the World

description.plain:
Not The End of the World is the sixth track from Katy Perry’s 5th studio album Smile. The song is about pushing through hard times and knowing that it is not the end of the world.

Katy first played this song on the first week of her Smile Sundays livestream. The snippet of the song become popular on social media for its similarities to Perry’s 2013 hit song “Dark Horse’s” trap sound.

On December 21st, 2020, Perry released the music video for the song starring the Grammy nominated singer and actress Zooey Deschanel. The video was filmed right after Perry gave birth. Hence, Deschanel taking on the persona of Katy Perry.

songs.full_title: Tsunami by Katy Perry
songs.title: Tsunami

description.plain:
In “Tsunami”, Katy likens love and sex to swimming in an ocean, and the movement with her lover creating a tsunami.

For reference, a tsunami is a giant wave of water caused by an earthquake. In Japanese, it quite literally means “harbour wave”.

Katy hinted at this song many times all throughout 2020 with tweets and Instagram posts:

Katy is saying that, after going through some hard times with her partner, she is now in a stage of her relationship that the only problems they get are superficial.

songs.full_title: What Makes a Woman by Katy Perry
songs.title: What Makes a Woman

description.plain:
The last track of Smile finds Katy Perry filling a country-folkish ballad with common assumptions of what exactly it is that defines a woman. The song grew from the mental and emotional battles that Perry continuously faced following the heavy criticism of her previous album Witness.

Upon its release, Perry revealed that the song is dedicated to her daughter Daisy, who she gave birth to in August 2020, although the song had been in the works before she became pregnant.

Perry further revealed to NPR in August 2020 that the song felt redefined after she became pregnant, adding:

 I believe, even now in my last trimester of pregnancy, it’s like, “Man, women can handle so much and are so diverse and so adaptable.” It’s a song that tries to pose a question about how do you define a woman? Well, if you know how to measure a woman, you may not be a woman, first and foremost. But it’s an amazing, beautiful thing and I feel this [awe] about bringing in a little girl to the world.

songs.full_title: Teary Eyes by Katy Perry
songs.title: Teary Eyes

description.plain:
Teary Eyes is the 3rd track off Katy Perry’s 5th Studio Album Smile.
Here she’s talking about moving on and continues to live your life even though you’re going through something painful or that still makes you cry, one day all the pain will be over and your “eyes will dry”
Katy said this is her favorite song of the album, and coincidentally the rhythm of delivering vocals matches with her hit song Firework., which according to Katy, is her favorite song to sing live.

Katy said this is her favorite song of the album, and coincidentally the rhythm of delivering vocals matches with her hit song Firework., which according to Katy, is her favorite song to sing live.

songs.full_title: Only Love by Katy Perry
songs.title: Only Love

description.plain: Katy reflects on what she would do if she was told she would have one more day left and she decides to focus on the most important things in life: God, family, peace, her husband and of course little Daisy Bloom. She doesn’t want to pay attention to all the negativity and hate there is in the world, rather she chooses LOVE in all its forms!

description.plain: “Ghost” is a song that Katy Perry wrote about her ex-boyfriend John Mayer. She sings about how she now sees through him and knows exactly the kind of person he is, and compares her memory of him to being similar to a ghost.

songs.full_title: Act My Age by Katy Perry
songs.title: Act My Age

description.plain:
‘Act my Age’ is the seventeenth and closing track of the deluxe edition of ‘Witness’



On the track, Katy is attacking ageism and talks about it from a female point of view, because when the woman ages, she is constantly told that she will lose her beauty, she will no longer be attractive, her sex life will die completely and many stupid restrictions. Also considering that Katy during her career has received criticism of being “a 30-year-old woman acting childlike and a 13-year-old girl,” this song may be a response to those criticisms.

description.plain:
“Bigger Than Me” is a self reflecting anthem about finding one’s purpose from Katy Perry’s album Witness, released on June 9th, 2017.

According to Billboard, the song is “a track inspired by Hillary Clinton’s loss in the 2016 presidential election”.

songs.full_title: Into Me You See by Katy Perry
songs.title: Into Me You See

description.plain:
“Into Me You See” is the concluding song on the standard edition of the album Witness. The track is a love ballad where Perry talks about how her lover was able to break the walls she built around herself.

The song’s title is a play on words as it sounds like the word “intimacy” when said fast enough.

The song is dedicated to her now-fiancé Orlando Bloom. Perry performed the song for the first time during her ‘Witness: The Tour’ in Asia while Bloom was in the audience.

songs.full_title: Waking Up in Vegas by Katy Perry
songs.title: Waking Up in Vegas

description.plain: “Waking Up in Vegas” is a song by Katy Perry, released as the fourth and final single from One of the Boys. The song is an ode to Las Vegas, describing an experience in the city. In response to her boyfriend’s complaints, Katy reminds him of what he told her: “That’s what you get for waking up in Vegas”.

songs.full_title: Cozy Little Christmas by Katy Perry
songs.title: Cozy Little Christmas

description.plain:
“Cozy Little Christmas” is Katy Perry’s second Christmas song after “Every Day is a Holiday”, which was released as promotion for H&M in 2015. Perry wrote the song about spending Christmas with her family in Copenhagen and the lyrics talk about not needing gifts as love is more important.

The song was released as an Amazon Music exclusive in 2018, with the song intended to be released to all platforms in the near future, which happened in 2019, when the song was released digitally.

songs.full_title: Mind Maze by Katy Perry
songs.title: Mind Maze

description.plain:
The song is about losing your track and trying to find your way out of a situation in which it is a difficult choice between something. “Mind Maze” is the seventh track from Katy Perry’s Witness album.

In her Witness World Wide stream Katy said that this song is about how sometimes it’s hard to navigate this world, and she wonders if she just pushes the reset button and surrender to love, and surrender to loving herself, she would wonder if she’d still be able to have all the things that she dreamed of as Katheryn Hudson, and also having a delicate balance with them.

songs.full_title: Circle the Drain by Katy Perry
songs.title: Circle the Drain

description.plain: Released as a promotional single, “Circle the Drain” is said to have been about Perry’s ex-boyfriend, Gym Class Heroes' own Travie McCoy. In the lyrics, Perry criticizes him for his drug use and details how it affected, and ultimately ended, their relationship together.

songs.full_title: One of the Boys by Katy Perry
songs.title: One of the Boys

description.plain: “One of the Boys” is a song about Katy’s frustration over being seen as just another of her crush’s friends. She takes it upon herself to attract the boy’s attention. The song is also about Katy’s transition from being a “tomboy” to a woman who is openly feminine.

songs.title: Not Like the Movies

description.plain: “Not Like the Movies” is about a love that is cinematic and dramatic like the kind of love you see in the movies. Katy sings about not having yet experienced that kind of love, but still holding on to a hope that someday she will and that her one true love is somewhere out there waiting for her.

songs.full_title: Hummingbird Heartbeat by Katy Perry
songs.title: Hummingbird Heartbeat

description.plain:
“Hummingbird Heartbeat” is a song in which Katy sings about her lover, who is so incredible that he makes her heart beat as fast as a hummingbird’s whenever he’s around.

In an interview with BBC’s Newsbeat, Perry revealed:

Her fiancé Russell Brand had an impact on Teenage Dream. Some of the tracks were recorded before the singer met the British comedian, but their relationship impacted on several of the later tracks. She said: “There are some songs on the album inspired by love. There’s a song called Hummingbird Heartbeat. He gives me that Hummingbird Heartbeat.”

songs.full_title: This Moment by Katy Perry
songs.title: This Moment

description.plain: “This Moment” is a 80’s-throwback anthem about taking one’s time to enjoy today. Katy wrote the song after being inspired by Eckhart Tolle’s book “The Power of Now”.

songs.full_title: Who Am I Living For? by Katy Perry
songs.title: Who Am I Living For?

description.plain: “Who Am I Living For?” is a song in which Katy battles with her religious upbringing and struggles to come to terms with who, or what, she’s living her life for. The song is heavily laced with Biblical and Theological imagery, it references the biblical story of Esther, while retaining the overall theme of the struggle between living for the world and living for God.

songs.full_title: Pearl by Katy Perry
songs.title: Pearl

description.plain: “Pearl” is a song documenting a woman who has allowed a man to bring her down and keep her from reaching her goals. Towards the end, Katy reveals that she was the woman allowing a man to control her, but she ultimately woke up and regained control of her life.

songs.full_title: Dressin' Up by Katy Perry
songs.title: Dressin’ Up

description.plain:
“Dressin' Up” is a song by American singer Katy Perry, which appears on Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection. The incomplete demo of the song originally appeared online two years prior to the release of Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection. The demo version features different production than the final version.

Lyrically, “Dressin' Up” is a saucy song about roleplay in the bedroom.

songs.full_title: Swish Swish (Radio Edit) by Katy Perry (Ft. Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Swish Swish (Radio Edit)

description.plain: Information about the original version can be seen here. A clean version/radio edit has been sent to some radio stations, according to AllAccess. The first difference between the album/explicit version and the clean/radio edit is that the swear words “shit”, “nigga”, “bitch” are censored. The second difference is that when it gets to the second time the chorus comes in, “Swish, swish, bish, another one in the basket, can’t touch this, another one in the casket” is removed.

The second difference is that when it gets to the second time the chorus comes in, “Swish, swish, bish, another one in the basket, can’t touch this, another one in the casket” is removed.

songs.full_title: Every Day Is A Holiday by Katy Perry
songs.title: Every Day Is A Holiday

description.plain:
The song was written for H&M’s Christmas Campaign – Happy & Merry.

In the song, Perry explains how the presence of her man makes her happy every day.

The lyrical content of the song is very repetitive and the steady beat alongside a joyful choir might remind someone of “Walking On Air” mixed with “Birthday.”

songs.full_title: Waving Through a Window by Katy Perry
songs.title: Waving Through a Window

description.plain:
Katy Perry has released her own version of the song “Waving Through a Window” from the Tony-winning musical Dear Evan Hansen.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BporcpEHYZ6/

The pop star recorded the song for the Deluxe Edition of the Broadway musical’s cast recording. She released a statement in which she talked about seeing the show for the first time last year and how she related to the song.

songs.full_title: Energy by Katy Perry
songs.title: Energy

description.plain: “Energy” is a scrapped song by Katy Perry, previously supposed to be included on her fifth studio album “Smile”. According to some insiders, “Energy” was recorded when the album was almost finished, and after some adjustments, Perry decided to scrap it and maintain the 12-song tracklist (standard edition).

songs.full_title: Smile (Original Version) by Katy Perry (Ft. Diddy)
songs.title: Smile (Original Version)

description.plain:
In the upbeat summer anthem, “Smile,” American singer-songwriter Katy Perry and American rapper Diddy talk about battling failures and rejection before being able to “crack that smile.” The Diddy-featured version of “Smile” is exclusively available on the vinyl version of Smile, while the solo version was used for all other releases.

In early May 2020, the Diddy-featured version leaked online. A few months later in July 2020, the song was registered under Perry’s name on both ASCAP and BMI as “Smile (I’m Grateful),” with both registrations including Diddy’s feature on the track.

annotatable.title: Smile (Original Version)

body.plain:
In the upbeat summer anthem, “Smile,” American singer-songwriter Katy Perry and American rapper Diddy talk about battling failures and rejection before being able to “crack that smile.” The Diddy-featured version of “Smile” is exclusively available on the vinyl version of Smile, while the solo version was used for all other releases.

In early May 2020, the Diddy-featured version leaked online. A few months later in July 2020, the song was registered under Perry’s name on both ASCAP and BMI as “Smile (I’m Grateful),” with both registrations including Diddy’s feature on the track.

songs.full_title: Message from Katy Perry by Katy Perry
songs.title: Message from Katy Perry

description.plain:
“Message from Katy Perry” is a voice memo from Katy Perry to her listeners and fans. This is only featured in the Target Exclusive edition of SMILE.

in this voice memo, Katy can be heard expressing gratitude to her loyal fanbase, the KatyCats, while also explaining what this record means to her as an artist and a person.

songs.embed_content: Read “Message from Katy Perry” by Katy Perry on Genius

annotatable.link_title: Message from Katy Perry by Katy Perry
annotatable.title: Message from Katy Perry

body.plain:
“Message from Katy Perry” is a voice memo from Katy Perry to her listeners and fans. This is only featured in the Target Exclusive edition of SMILE.

in this voice memo, Katy can be heard expressing gratitude to her loyal fanbase, the KatyCats, while also explaining what this record means to her as an artist and a person.

songs.lyrics:
Hello to everybody listening to Smile, it's Katy Perry.
I wanna say a very special hello to all of my incredible, beautiful, loyal, encouraging KatyCats all around the world.
Thank you so much for being on this journey with me every single time I put out a record, and for being excited and letting the music, um... work its magic on you, and for showing up at the shows, and all the little places, and for being such an incredible team and a support system that I can always rely on.
I am so incredibly grateful for each and every one of you, and the things that you make online, that make me laugh, and the care that you show, and... all of it, I am so profoundly grateful.
And that's what a lot of this record is: it's, it's a... a record that I never really set out to make, but here we are. You know, after continuing my writing process for 2 years, I would get a little message and just be a vessel for, um... different songs or ideas over the past 2 years, and we had many of them so we felt like, maybe it should be a record. Maybe the record should be called "Smile", and it should be about finding your smile once again.
Um... I don't know about any of you, but sometimes I can feel super low, and alone, and really in my head, and be my own worst enemy, and let that horrible negative voice that trickle, trickles in and out of my, of my head, take over. And, in this past couple of years I've really, um, tried to work on that; and I think a lot of these songs reflect walking through that process, walking through that valley, and coming out the other end alive, and giving live, and, um...
So, I just, I'm so grateful you guys are listening, I, um... I'm excited, I wanna know what your favorite songs are. I have one more song that you're about to hear, um, this song is kind of a funny, sassy song. Definitely don't @ me when you hear it, but thank you once again for listening to all the songs. I hope these songs are encouraging and can lift you out of whatever you're feeling, or give you a little umpfh, or, um... give you whatever you need for today. And if you lost your smile, it helps you find your smile again.
God bless you! I love you.

description.plain: Information about the original version with Migos can be seen here. Some radio stations play a version of the song without Migos. The difference between this solo version, and the original version, is that Migos' lines are replaced with a Katy bridge that uses some of the same lines from other parts of the song. Another difference is at the end of the song, where extra lines: “Woop! Oh, yeah, yeah, Woop! Bon appetit, baby” are added

songs.full_title: Passenger by Katy Perry
songs.title: Passenger

description.plain:
“Passenger” is a song original recorded by Britney Spears for her album, Britney Jean. The song was originally written by Britney Spears, Thomas Pentz, Sia Furler, Andrew Swanson and Katy Perry.

The song was originally meant for Katy Perry’s album, Prism in 2013, but was given to Spear’s instead for her album.

Perry’s version of the song leaked online on June 18th, 2017.

description.plain:
Song originally leaked as file name, “Attention”, but was later changed. In the leaked lyrics by Music Mafia, it did not reference or state anything about Attention.

Speculative confirmed session recording of this song was leaked online by Music Mafia including it’s lyrcis. What was leaked was an instrumental version, leaked, demo recording of Lainie Kazan, information on when the song was recorded and speculated name. Lainie Kazan was considered and demoed for the feature, but Music Mafia articles suspect she may be scraped from it and replaced by Taylor Swift because of her speculated demo which was leaked more recently.

songs.full_title: Brick by Brick by Katy Perry
songs.title: Brick by Brick

description.plain:
“Brick By Brick” is a song written by Katy Perry and Greg Wells.

The song is part of the set list for the live album, MTV Unplugged.

During the song’s initial run, it was only performed live in places, such as: The Hotel Café, encore events at concerts, stripped performances etc.) but was later leaked on the internet.

The song is rumored to have been originally been written for Ashley Tisdale, but has been unconfirmed.

songs.full_title: Trust In Me by Katy Perry
songs.title: Trust In Me

description.plain:
On Hudson’s old website, she explained the story behind the song, saying:

This was my first try at songwriting. I was feeling a little depressed at the time, and was thinking about all the things I’d done wrong. I felt like I was oil and God was water, and I just wouldn’t mix. I started writing about this and God placed a peace in my heart. I really felt He was saying “don’t worry child, trust in me.” I just had to open my heart to the healing process. It’s funny how sometimes we think that we can be so horrible that God would turn His back to His own. I guess we will never really understand His mercy until we see His Glory.

songs.full_title: Long Shot by Katy Perry
songs.title: Long Shot

description.plain:
“Long Shot” is an unreleased song from Katy Perry.  The song was given to Kelly Clarkson for her All I Ever Wanted album. Kelly’s version can be heard here.

The song was originally recorded by Perry’s album, (A) Katy Perry, however, the song was left unused due to the album’s cancellation.

songs.full_title: Use Your Love by Katy Perry
songs.title: Use Your Love

description.plain: ‘Use Your Love’ is a cover of ‘Your Love’ originally performed by The Outfield with the lyrics slightly altered to fit a female perspective. Before releasing the EP ‘Ur So Gay’ Katy’s Label recommended she include a cover. Originally she wanted to do a Queen cover, however after hearing the original version of ‘Your Love’ in a club and seeing everyone there immediately start dancing, she decided to do a cover in the hope to get the same reaction.

songs.full_title: Witness (Demo) by Katy Perry
songs.title: Witness (Demo)

description.plain:
“Witness (Demo)” is a song by Katy Perry that leaked online on May 31, 2016 as a demo version of the song, hence why “demo” is in the title. Back in 2016, a hacker hacked Katy Perry’s Twitter and started posting “out of character messages” from Katy Perry.



The hacker also leaked a song, Witness, that Katy had been working on. It was assumed at the time that it could have been a song from Katy Perry’s upcoming album, which was untitled at the time of the song leak. Ultimately, the final version of the song was included on Katy Perry’s album, Witness, which was released on June 8th, 2017.

There are a few differences between the demo version and the final version of the song. In the demo version of the song, the last 1:20 minutes or so are strictly instrumental. In the final version of the song, this is not the case. A new pre-chorus and bridge were added, along with an outro.

songs.full_title: Search Me by Katy Perry
songs.title: Search Me

description.plain:
Hudson explained the meaning of the song on her site in 2001.

“I was struggling with the fact that I would have the huge responsibility of how others would be affected through what I was doing or saying on stage. I don’t want to put on some kind of front that everything is good when it’s not. I wanted to keep it real, but still give people hope. I was trying to figure out how to combine the two, so I put my gifts on the shelf for a period of time. I looked back and realized God was with me through this season of my life. He knew one day I would wake up and remember the amazing gift I was given and how so many other people would love to be on the stage that I had been letting collect dust.”

songs.full_title: It's Okay To Believe by Katy Perry
songs.title: It’s Okay To Believe

description.plain:
“It’s Okay to Believe” is a song written by Katy Perry, Glen Ballard, and Matt Thiessen for Perry’s unreleased album, (A) Katy Perry. This song is registered on Perry’s ASCAP twice. Once as “It’s Okay To Believe” and again as simply, “It’s Okay”.

A music video was shot for the song, but only a preview was released via Katy Perry’s promo DVD in 2005. Parts of the video were shot in Paris, France. The clip was featured in the official trailer for Katy Perry: Part of Me, as well as the film itself.

songs.full_title: Wish You The Worst by Katy Perry
songs.title: Wish You The Worst

description.plain:
“Wish You the Worst” (also known as “Wishing You the Worst”) is a song written by Katy Perry, Adrienne Follesé, Keith Follesé, and Nick Trevisick. It was recorded for Perry’s unreleased album, (A) Katy Perry. In 2013, producer Nick Trevisick uploaded the song along with two other collaborations with Perry, “Agree to Disagree” and “I Can”, which are available to stream.

It was later re-recorded by American Idol semi-finalist, Kady Malloy, for an independently released self-titled album. The album was released on Aimestreet.com. The release date for the album on the site says November 30, 1999, but the song was written sometime between 2005-2006. Since then the artist has uploaded the audio on YouTube.

songs.full_title: Piercing by Katy Perry
songs.title: Piercing

description.plain:
Hudson explained the story behind the song on her site in 2001.
“This is an aggressive song because I hate how people are so blinded by the so-called "necessities” of life, when truly nothing on this earth will ever satisfy you. I wanted to write a song about how people are so infatuated with the things of this world. We wrote about how everyone is so blinded with what they want, but they don’t know what they really need."

songs.full_title: My Own Monster by Katy Perry
songs.title: My Own Monster

description.plain:
Hudson explained the meaning of the song on her site in 2001.

“After asking kids in a joking kind of way if they still had nightlights, they responded with a cheer, after I exposed one of my more personal secrets with them, that I too struggle with fear. One night I realized I needed God "to help me, to hold me,” as the chorus says. Growing up, my parents would tell me to pray when I got scared, and to tell the devil to flee. I remembered all that and wanted to write about how I find my refuge underneath His wings. You can’t open up to fear, it’ll eat you up."

songs.full_title: Daisies (Acoustic) by Katy Perry
songs.title: Daisies (Acoustic)

description.plain:
Marking the start of a new era, “Daisies” is a self-empowerment anthem by American singer-songwriter Katy Perry. Shortly after the track’s release, Katy took to her social media platforms to share the inspiration behind the song:

I wrote this song a couple [of] months ago as a call to remain true to the course you’ve set for yourself, regardless of what others may think.

She then elaborated on how the song has “taken a new meaning [for her]” after parts of the world went into a lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Unlike her past lead singles which tend to be more upbeat and bubbly, “Daisies” features a mid-tempo production in its verses and a guitar in its chorus. This is also Katy’s first time working with The Monsters & Strangerz — an American production and songwriting team who has previously worked on hits like January 2018’s “The Middle.”

songs.full_title: Growing Pains by Katy Perry
songs.title: Growing Pains

description.plain:
Hudson explained the meaning of the song on her site in 2001.

“I think this is what kids want to say, like it’s their anthem. I think they don’t like being written off as if they didn’t know much about God or what they really believe in. Sometimes older people can easily stereotype this generation because of what it has been told–basically, the lies that say we aren’t any good, or all we will do is drugs and get into a bunch of trouble. It’s not true. I haven’t ever seen an age limit on who God can use. I don’t have it all figured out, but for me, I want to share what I know, and give everything I have been given, because that is my calling.”
The song was inspired by Queen, one of Katy Perry’s favorite bands, and the song was supposed to have some elements of Queen’s song “Bohemian Rhapsody”.

songs.full_title: Hook Up by Katy Perry
songs.title: Hook Up

description.plain:
“Hook Up” is a song written by Katy Perry, Greg Wells, and Kara DioGuardi. The song was originally intended for Katy Perry in 2006 for her unreleased album, (A) Katy Perry, but was ultimately given to Kelly Clarkson for her 2009 album, All I Ever Wanted.

After the song was sent to Kelly Clarkson, only one lyric change was made. Katy Perry’s lyric, “Keep your thing in your pants and your heart on your sleeve” was changed to “Keep your head on my hand and your heart on your sleeve” on Kelly Clarkson’s version.

songs.full_title: Part of Me (Demo Version) by Katy Perry
songs.title: Part of Me (Demo Version)

description.plain:
Please refer to the final version of the song for information about the song and on annotated lines.

A demo version of Katy Perry’s “Part of Me” leaked online in 2010, two years before the song was officially released on Perry’s “Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection” album in 2012.

There are a few differences between the demo version and the final version. In the final version of the song, the line “So you can keep the diamond ring, it don’t mean nothing anyway” is replaced with “You can keep the dog for me, I never liked him anyway”. This suggests that the line in the demo version was changed for the final version of the song to coincide with Perry’s divorce from her then husband Russel Brand. The second difference is that the outro in the final version is completely removed. The outro in the final version is replaced with the final chorus in the demo version, repeating twice.

songs.full_title: Last Call by Katy Perry
songs.title: Last Call

description.plain:
Hudson explained the meaning of the song on her site in 2001.

“The title practically explains everything. I was reading the book called "Last Call For Help” by Dawson McAllister and my dad came home one day and said I was supposed to write a song about someone’s “Last Call.” He didn’t even know I was reading that book. I was thinking of all the stories in the book of how the kids were desperate for help and had tried so many areas. I wanted to do my own hotline so I used the number of the church my dad pastors, 899-3833. I made the character realize that this phone call to God for help was the best one he ever made."

description.plain:
Information about the original version with Juicy J can be seen here. Some radio stations play a version of the song without Juicy J’s rap. The song without the rap has also officially been featured in the video game Just Dance 2015.

The difference between this solo version, and the original version, is that Juicy J’s lyrics are replaced with an instrumental in the intro and the lyrics “make me your Aphrodite” and “make me your one and only” in the third verse.

songs.full_title: Nothing Like the First Time by Katy Perry
songs.title: Nothing Like the First Time

description.plain:
“Nothing Like the First Time” is a song written by Katy Perry and David A. Stewart. The song is registered on ASCAP as “The First Time”.

Because of her Christian upbringing, Perry said that she was “scared to write about certain subjects because I was still virginal,” adding “I remember I wrote a song called ‘Nothing Like the First Time’ and I was really scared to present it because it had some risqué lyrics.” Glen Ballard encouraged her to write about anything she felt, which made Perry feel “so free”. In a 2019 interview with Paper Magazine, she mentioned the track, saying: “I felt so bad, but then I loved it.”

songs.lyrics:
*Phone rings*
Hello?
Hi, it's me, can I come over?

Sometimes I want a shot of your Novocaine
I think I found the switch that turns off the brain
Locate the black hole that I can jump right through

'Cause my ears, they won't stop ringing
I won't stand another pick up line
Oh, my heart, it will stop beating
If I don't see you tonight

I'm throwing down some drinks, and then speed dialin'
I think I'm gonna wake you up
I stutter when I speak, but I'm not lying
I think I want you way too much
These things I confess, they just lead to a dysfunctional love
Just don't hang up
Just, just don't hang up

Running away is not the solution
My head's not straight with all this pollution
Electronic gadgets add to the confusion

So, are you on your own?
Or should I take a rain check?
Now am I going home?
Or will I cry my eyes out?

I'm throwing down some drinks, and then speed dialin'
I think I'm gonna wake you up
I stutter when I speak, but I'm not lying
I think I want you way too much
These things I confess, they just lead to a dysfunctional love
Don't hang up

There wouldn't be so much to say
If I wasn't in this all to stay
Is it too late
For us to communicate?

I, I, I, speed dialin'
I, I, I, speed dialin'

I'm throwing down some drinks, and then speed dialin'
I think I'm gonna wake you up
I stutter when I speak, but I'm not lying
I think I want you way too much

Don't hang up
'Cause I want you way too much
Out of luck
Because you're too far for me to touch
Don't hang up
Because I need you way too much

songs.full_title: Whatever You Say by Katy Perry
songs.title: Whatever You Say

description.plain: “Whatever You Say” is an unreleased song from Katy Perry, which leaked online on May 30th, 2019. The song has a rock feel to it, which suggests the song may have been recorded during The Matrix sessions.

songs.full_title: Normalize* by Katy Perry
songs.title: Normalize*

description.plain: “Normalize” is the unofficial title of an unreleased song by Katy Perry. It was written for her fifth studio album, Witness, however, it did not make the cut. Perry shared a short snippet of the song with isolated vocals through her Instagram story.

songs.full_title: That's More Like It by Katy Perry
songs.title: That’s More Like It

description.plain:
“That’s More Like It” is an unreleased song by Katy Perry, which was ultimately given to Selena Gomez & the Scene for their third studio album, When The Sun Goes Down.

Over a year after the album release, on August 25th, 2012, a snippet of Katy Perry’s original demo of the song leaked, followed by the leak of the full demo soon after.
